A. 340.93K

To determine the surface temperature of the heat source, we can use the Stefan-Boltzmann law, which relates the temperature of a surface to the rate of heat transfer from the surface to the surroundings. The formula for the Stefan-Boltzmann law is:

\[ q = \sigma A \left( \frac{T^4}{T_0^4} \right) \]

where:
- \( q \) is the heat transfer rate (in W)
- \( \sigma \) is the Stefan-Boltzmann constant (5.67 × 10^-8 W/m²·K²)
- \( A \) is the surface area of the heat source (in m²)
- \( T \) is the temperature of the surface (in K)
- \( T_0 \) is the ambient temperature (in K)
